Class Statistics

java.lang.Object
fr.univparis.metro.Statistics
public class Statistics
extends Object
Class for statistics about our networks

  • Method Details

    • mostDistantStations

      public static <T> Pair<Pair<T,​T>,​Double> mostDistantStations​(WGraph<T> g, Predicate<T> p1, Predicate<T> p2)
      This function give the two stations the more distant on a network
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the vertices
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      p1 - is the predicate to applicate Dijkstra to an element of the graph
      p2 - is the predicate to comparate the weight between two elements of the graph
      Returns:
      a pair of pair of elements and the weight between these two elements which are the two elements the more distant on the graph

    • minimumCorrespondence

      public static <T> int minimumCorrespondence​(WGraph<T> g, Predicate<T> start, Predicate<T> end, BiPredicate<T,​T> p)
      Return the minimum correspondence to go from any start vertex to any end vertex
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the vertices
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      start - indicates wich vertex are start vertex
      end - indicates wich vertex are end vertex
      p - indicates what is consider as a correspondence
      Returns:
      the number of minimum correspondence

    • extremumLine

      public static String extremumLine​(WGraph<Station> g, boolean max)
      Return the line that has the more/less Station in it (excluding the Meta Line)
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      max - indicates if we want the line with the most station (max == true) or the line with the less (max == false) station
      Returns:
      the name of the line with the most/less station in it

    • averageTimeOnEachLine

      public static int averageTimeOnEachLine​(WGraph<Station> g, HashMap<String,​Double> res)
      Return the time average on each line
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      res - is an HashMap with a line associate with the time between the two extremum of it
      Returns:
      the HashMap of the lines and their average time of travel

    • shortestTimeTravelLine

      public static Pair<String,​Double> shortestTimeTravelLine​(WGraph<Station> g)
      Return a Pair of a String and a Double corresponding to the shortest line in time and this time thanks to the statistic averageTimeOnEachLine and his parameter res.
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      Returns:
      a Pair with the shortest line in time and his time of travel

    • longestTimeTravelLine

      public static Pair<String,​Double> longestTimeTravelLine​(WGraph<Station> g)
      Return a Pair of a String and a Double corresponding to the longest line in time and this time thanks to the statistic averageTimeOnEachLine and his parameter res.
      Parameters:
      g - the graph representing the network
      Returns:
      a Pair with the longest line in time and his time of travel

      Returns:
